olive tree; how much more shall these, which are the natural
, be grafted into their own olive tree?

contents.verseText: For I would not, brethren, have you ignorant of this mystery, lest ye be wise in your own conceits, that a hardening in part hath befallen Israel, until the fulness of the Gentiles be come in;
contents: For I would not, brethren, have you ignorant of this mystery, lest ye be wise in your own conceits, that a hardening in
part hath befallen Israel, until the fulness of the Gentiles be come in;

contents.verseText: and so all Israel shall be saved: even as it is written, There shall come out of Zion the Deliverer; He shall turn away ungodliness from Jacob:
contents: and so all Israel shall be saved: even as it is written,
There shall come out of Zion the Deliverer;
He shall turn away ungodliness from Jacob:

contents.verseText: And this is my covenant unto them, When I shall take away their sins.
contents: And this is my covenant unto them,
When I shall take away their sins.

contents.verseText: As touching the gospel, they are enemies for your sake: but as touching the election, they are beloved for the fathers’ sake.
contents: As touching the gospel, they are enemies for your sake: but as touching the election, they are beloved for the fathers’
sake.

contents.verseText: For the gifts and the calling of God are not repented of.
contents: For the gifts and the calling of God are not repented of.

contents.verseText: For as ye in time past were disobedient to God, but now have obtained mercy by their disobedience,
contents: For as ye in time past were disobedient to God, but now have obtained mercy by their disobedience,

contents.verseText: even so have these also now been disobedient, that by the mercy shown to you they also may now obtain mercy.
contents: even so have these also now been disobedient, that by the mercy shown to you they also may now obtain mercy.

contents.verseText: For God hath shut up all unto disobedience, that he might have mercy upon all.
contents: For God hath shut up all unto disobedience, that he might have mercy upon all.

contents.verseText: O the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and the knowledge of God! how unsearchable are his judgments, and his ways past tracing out!
contents: O the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and the knowledge of God! how unsearchable are his judgments, and his ways
past tracing out!

contents.verseText: For who hath known the mind of the Lord? or who hath been his counsellor?
contents: For who hath known the mind of the Lord? or who hath been his counsellor?

contents.verseText: or who hath first given to him, and it shall be recompensed unto him again?
contents: or who hath first given to him, and it shall be recompensed unto him again?

contents.verseText: For of him, and through him, and unto him, are all things. To him be the glory for ever. Amen.
contents: For of him, and through him, and unto him, are all things. To him
the glory for ever. Amen.

contents.verseText: I beseech you therefore, brethren, by the mercies of God, to present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable to God, which is your spiritual service.
contents: I beseech you therefore, brethren, by the mercies of God, to present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable to
God,
your spiritual service.

contents.verseText: And be not fashioned according to this world: but be ye transformed by the renewing of your mind, that ye may prove what is the good and acceptable and perfect will of God.
contents: And be not fashioned according to this world: but be ye transformed by the renewing of your mind, that ye may prove what
is the good and acceptable and perfect will of God.

contents.verseText: For I say, through the grace that was given me, to every man that is among you, not to think of himself more highly than he ought to think; but so to think as to think soberly, according as God hath dealt to each man a measure of faith.
contents: For I say, through the grace that was given me, to every man that is among you, not to think of himself more highly than
he ought to think; but so to think as to think soberly, according as God hath dealt to each man a measure of faith.

contents.verseText: For even as we have many members in one body, and all the members have not the same office:
contents: For even as we have many members in one body, and all the members have not the same office:

contents.verseText: so we, who are many, are one body in Christ, and severally members one of another.
contents: so we, who are many, are one body in Christ, and severally members one of another.

contents.verseText: And having gifts differing according to the grace that was given to us, whether prophecy, let us prophesy according to the proportion of our faith;
contents: And having gifts differing according to the grace that was given to us, whether prophecy,
according to the proportion of our faith;

contents.verseText: or ministry, let us give ourselves to our ministry; or he that teacheth, to his teaching;
contents: or ministry,
to our ministry; or he that teacheth, to his teaching;

contents.verseText: or he that exhorteth, to his exhorting: he that giveth, let him do it with liberality; he that ruleth, with diligence; he that showeth mercy, with cheerfulness.
contents: or he that exhorteth, to his exhorting: he that giveth,
with liberality; he that ruleth, with diligence; he that showeth mercy, with cheerfulness.

contents.verseText: Let love be without hypocrisy. Abhor that which is evil; cleave to that which is good.
contents: Let love be without hypocrisy. Abhor that which is evil; cleave to that which is good.

contents.verseText: In love of the brethren be tenderly affectioned one to another; in honor preferring one another;
contents: In love of the brethren be tenderly affectioned one to another; in honor preferring one another;

contents.verseText: in diligence not slothful; fervent in spirit; serving the Lord;
contents: in diligence not slothful; fervent in spirit; serving the Lord;

contents.verseText: rejoicing in hope; patient in tribulation; continuing stedfastly in prayer;
contents: rejoicing in hope; patient in tribulation; continuing stedfastly in prayer;

contents.verseText: communicating to the necessities of the saints; given to hospitality.
contents: communicating to the necessities of the saints; given to hospitality.

contents.verseText: Bless them that persecute you; bless, and curse not.
contents: Bless them that persecute you; bless, and curse not.

contents.verseText: Rejoice with them that rejoice; weep with them that weep.
contents: Rejoice with them that rejoice; weep with them that weep.

contents.verseText: Be of the same mind one toward another. Set not your mind on high things, but condescend to things that are lowly. Be not wise in your own conceits.
contents: Be of the same mind one toward another. Set not your mind on high things, but condescend to things that are lowly. Be not
wise in your own conceits.

contents.verseText: Render to no man evil for evil. Take thought for things honorable in the sight of all men.
contents: Render to no man evil for evil. Take thought for things honorable in the sight of all men.

contents.verseText: If it be possible, as much as in you lieth, be at peace with all men.
contents: If it be possible, as much as in you lieth, be at peace with all men.

contents.verseText: Avenge not yourselves, beloved, but give place unto the wrath of God: for it is written, Vengeance belongeth unto me; I will recompense, saith the Lord.
contents: Avenge not yourselves, beloved, but give place unto the wrath
: for it is written, Vengeance belongeth unto me; I will recompense, saith the Lord.

contents.verseText: But if thine enemy hunger, feed him; if he thirst, give him to drink: for in so doing thou shalt heap coals of fire upon his head.
contents: But if thine enemy hunger, feed him; if he thirst, give him to drink: for in so doing thou shalt heap coals of fire upon
his head.

contents.verseText: Be not overcome of evil, but overcome evil with good.
contents: Be not overcome of evil, but overcome evil with good.

contents.verseText: Let every soul be in subjection to the higher powers: for there is no power but of God; and the powers that be are ordained of God.
contents: Let every soul be in subjection to the higher powers: for there is no power but of God; and the
that be are ordained of God.

contents.verseText: Therefore he that resisteth the power, withstandeth the ordinance of God: and they that withstand shall receive to themselves judgment.
contents: Therefore he that resisteth the power, withstandeth the ordinance of God: and they that withstand shall receive to
themselves judgment.

contents.verseText: For rulers are not a terror to the good work, but to the evil. And wouldest thou have no fear of the power? do that which is good, and thou shalt have praise from the same:
contents: For rulers are not a terror to the good work, but to the evil. And wouldest thou have no fear of the power? do that which
is good, and thou shalt have praise from the same:

contents.verseText: for he is a minister of God to thee for good. But if thou do that which is evil, be afraid; for he beareth not the sword in vain: for he is a minister of God, an avenger for wrath to him that doeth evil.
contents: for he is a minister of God to thee for good. But if thou do that which is evil, be afraid; for he beareth not the sword
in vain: for he is a minister of God, an avenger for wrath to him that doeth evil.

contents.verseText: Wherefore ye must needs be in subjection, not only because of the wrath, but also for conscience’ sake.
contents: Wherefore
must needs be in subjection, not only because of the wrath, but also for conscience’ sake.

contents.verseText: For for this cause ye pay tribute also; for they are ministers of God’s service, attending continually upon this very thing.
contents: For for this cause ye pay tribute also; for they are ministers of God’s service, attending continually upon this very
thing.

contents.verseText: Render to all their dues: tribute to whom tribute is due; custom to whom custom; fear to whom fear; honor to whom honor.
contents: Render to all their dues: tribute to whom tribute
; custom to whom custom; fear to whom fear; honor to
whom honor.

contents.verseText: Owe no man anything, save to love one another: for he that loveth his neighbor hath fulfilled the law.
contents: Owe no man anything, save to love one another: for he that loveth his neighbor hath fulfilled the law.

contents.verseText: For this, Thou shalt not commit adultery, Thou shalt not kill, Thou shalt not steal, Thou shalt not covet, and if there be any other commandment, it is summed up in this word, namely, Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.
contents: For this, Thou shalt not commit adultery, Thou shalt not kill, Thou shalt not steal, Thou shalt not covet, and if there be
any other commandment, it is summed up in this word, namely, Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.

contents.verseText: Love worketh no ill to his neighbor: love therefore is the fulfilment of the law.
contents: Love worketh no ill to his neighbor: love therefore is the fulfilment of the law.

contents.verseText: And this, knowing the season, that already it is time for you to awake out of sleep: for now is salvation nearer to us than when we first believed.
contents: And this, knowing the season, that already it is time for you to awake out of sleep: for now is salvation nearer to us
than when we
believed.

contents.verseText: The night is far spent, and the day is at hand: let us therefore cast off the works of darkness, and let us put on the armor of light.
contents: The night is far spent, and the day is at hand: let us therefore cast off the works of darkness, and let us put on the
armor of light.

contents.verseText: Let us walk becomingly, as in the day; not in revelling and drunkenness, not in chambering and wantonness, not in strife and jealousy.
contents: Let us walk becomingly, as in the day; not in revelling and drunkenness, not in chambering and wantonness, not in strife
and jealousy.

contents.verseText: But put ye on the Lord Jesus Christ, and make not provision for the flesh, to fulfil the lusts thereof.
contents: But put ye on the Lord Jesus Christ, and make not provision for the flesh, to
the lusts

contents.verseText: But him that is weak in faith receive ye, yet not for decision of scruples.
contents: But him that is weak in faith receive ye,
not for decision of scruples.

contents.verseText: One man hath faith to eat all things: but he that is weak eateth herbs.
contents: One man hath faith to eat all things: but he that is weak eateth herbs.

contents.verseText: Let not him that eateth set at nought him that eateth not; and let not him that eateth not judge him that eateth: for God hath received him.
contents: Let not him that eateth set at nought him that eateth not; and let not him that eateth not judge him that eateth: for God
hath received him.

contents.verseText: Who art thou that judgest the servant of another? to his own lord he standeth or falleth. Yea, he shall be made to stand; for the Lord hath power to make him stand.
contents: Who art thou that judgest the servant of another? to his own lord he standeth or falleth. Yea, he shall be made to stand;
for the Lord hath power to make him stand.

contents.verseText: One man esteemeth one day above another: another esteemeth every day alike. Let each man be fully assured in his own mind.
contents: One man esteemeth one day above another: another esteemeth every day
. Let each man be fully assured in his own mind.

contents.verseText: He that regardeth the day, regardeth it unto the Lord: and he that eateth, eateth unto the Lord, for he giveth God thanks; and he that eateth not, unto the Lord he eateth not, and giveth God thanks.
contents: He that regardeth the day, regardeth it unto the Lord: and he that eateth, eateth unto the Lord, for he giveth God thanks;
and he that eateth not, unto the Lord he eateth not, and giveth God thanks.

contents.verseText: For none of us liveth to himself, and none dieth to himself.
contents: For none of us liveth to himself, and none dieth to himself.

contents.verseText: For whether we live, we live unto the Lord; or whether we die, we die unto the Lord: whether we live therefore, or die, we are the Lord’s.
contents: For whether we live, we live unto the Lord; or whether we die, we die unto the Lord: whether we live therefore, or die, we
are the Lord’s.

contents.verseText: For to this end Christ died and lived again, that he might be Lord of both the dead and the living.
contents: For to this end Christ died and lived
, that he might be Lord of both the dead and the living.

contents.verseText: But thou, why dost thou judge thy brother? or thou again, why dost thou set at nought thy brother? for we shall all stand before the judgment-seat of God.
contents: But thou, why dost thou judge thy brother? or thou again, why dost thou set at nought thy brother? for we shall all stand
before the judgment-seat of God.

contents.verseText: For it is written, As I live, saith the Lord, to me every knee shall bow, And every tongue shall confess to God.
contents: For it is written,
As I live, saith the Lord, to me every knee shall bow,
And every tongue shall confess to God.

contents.verseText: So then each one of us shall give account of himself to God.
contents: So then each one of us shall give account of himself to God.

contents.verseText: Let us not therefore judge one another any more: but judge ye this rather, that no man put a stumblingblock in his brother’s way, or an occasion of falling.
contents: Let us not therefore judge one another any more: but judge ye this rather, that no man put a stumblingblock in his
brother’s way, or an occasion of falling.

contents.verseText: I know, and am persuaded in the Lord Jesus, that nothing is unclean of itself: save that to him who accounteth anything to be unclean, to him it is unclean.
contents: I know, and am persuaded in the Lord Jesus, that nothing is unclean of itself: save that to him who accounteth anything
to be unclean, to him it is unclean.

contents.verseText: For if because of meat thy brother is grieved, thou walkest no longer in love. Destroy not with thy meat him for whom Christ died.
contents: For if because of meat thy brother is grieved, thou walkest no longer in love. Destroy not with thy meat him for whom
Christ died.

contents.verseText: Let not then your good be evil spoken of:
contents: Let not then your good be evil spoken of:

contents.verseText: for the kingdom of God is not eating and drinking, but righteousness and peace and joy in the Holy Spirit.
contents: for the kingdom of God is not eating and drinking, but righteousness and peace and joy in the Holy Spirit.

contents.verseText: For he that herein serveth Christ is well-pleasing to God, and approved of men.
contents: For he that herein serveth Christ is well-pleasing to God, and approved of men.

contents.verseText: So then let us follow after things which make for peace, and things whereby we may edify one another.
contents: So then let us follow after things which make for peace, and things whereby we may edify one another.

contents.verseText: Overthrow not for meat’s sake the work of God. All things indeed are clean; howbeit it is evil for that man who eateth with offence.
contents: Overthrow not for meat’s sake the work of God. All things indeed are clean; howbeit it is evil for that man who eateth
with offence.

contents.verseText: It is good not to eat flesh, nor to drink wine, nor to do anything whereby thy brother stumbleth.
contents: It is good not to eat flesh, nor to drink wine, nor
whereby thy brother stumbleth.

contents.verseText: The faith which thou hast, have thou to thyself before God. Happy is he that judgeth not himself in that which he approveth.
contents: The faith which thou hast, have thou to thyself before God. Happy is he that judgeth not himself in that which he
approveth.

contents.verseText: But he that doubteth is condemned if he eat, because he eateth not of faith; and whatsoever is not of faith is sin.
contents: But he that doubteth is condemned if he eat, because
not of faith; and whatsoever is not of faith is sin.

contents.verseText: Now we that are strong ought to bear the infirmities of the weak, and not to please ourselves.
contents: Now we that are strong ought to bear the infirmities of the weak, and not to please ourselves.

contents.verseText: Let each one of us please his neighbor for that which is good, unto edifying.
contents: Let each one of us please his neighbor for that which is good, unto edifying.

contents.verseText: For Christ also pleased not himself; but, as it is written, The reproaches of them that reproached thee fell upon me.
contents: For Christ also pleased not himself; but, as it is written, The reproaches of them that reproached thee fell upon me.

contents.verseText: For whatsoever things were written aforetime were written for our learning, that through patience and through comfort of the scriptures we might have hope.
contents: For whatsoever things were written aforetime were written for our learning, that through patience and through comfort of
the scriptures we might have hope.

contents.verseText: Now the God of patience and of comfort grant you to be of the same mind one with another according to Christ Jesus:
contents: Now the God of patience and of comfort grant you to be of the same mind one with another according to Christ Jesus:

contents.verseText: that with one accord ye may with one mouth glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.
contents: that with one accord ye may with one mouth glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.

contents.verseText: Wherefore receive ye one another, even as Christ also received you, to the glory of God.
contents: Wherefore receive ye one another, even as Christ also received you, to the glory of God.

contents.verseText: For I say that Christ hath been made a minister of the circumcision for the truth of God, that he might confirm the promises given unto the fathers,
contents: For I say that Christ hath been made a minister of the circumcision for the truth of God, that he might confirm the
promises
unto the fathers,

contents.verseText: and that the Gentiles might glorify God for his mercy; as it is written, Therefore will I give praise unto thee among the Gentiles, And sing unto thy name.
contents: and that the Gentiles might glorify God for his mercy; as it is written,
Therefore will I give praise unto thee among the Gentiles,
And sing unto thy name.

contents.verseText: And again he saith, Rejoice, ye Gentiles, with his people.
contents: And again he saith,
Rejoice, ye Gentiles, with his people.

contents.verseText: And again, Praise the Lord, all ye Gentiles; And let all the peoples praise him.
contents: And again,
Praise the Lord, all ye Gentiles;
And let all the peoples praise him.

contents.verseText: And again, Isaiah saith, There shall be the root of Jesse, And he that ariseth to rule over the Gentiles; On him shall the Gentiles hope.
contents: And again, Isaiah saith,
There shall be the root of Jesse,
And he that ariseth to rule over the Gentiles;
On him shall the Gentiles hope.

contents.verseText: Now the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, that ye may abound in hope, in the power of the Holy Spirit.
contents: Now the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, that ye may abound in hope, in the power of the Holy
Spirit.

contents.verseText: And I myself also am persuaded of you, my brethren, that ye yourselves are full of goodness, filled with all knowledge, able also to admonish one another.
contents: And I myself also am persuaded of you, my brethren, that ye yourselves are full of goodness, filled with all knowledge,
able also to admonish one another.

contents.verseText: But I write the more boldly unto you in some measure, as putting you again in remembrance, because of the grace that was given me of God,
contents: But I write the more boldly unto you in some measure, as putting you again in remembrance, because of the grace that was
given me of God,

contents.verseText: that I should be a minister of Christ Jesus unto the Gentiles, ministering the gospel of God, that the offering up of the Gentiles might be made acceptable, being sanctified by the Holy Spirit.
contents: that I should be a minister of Christ Jesus unto the Gentiles, ministering the gospel of God, that the offering up of the
Gentiles might be made acceptable, being sanctified by the Holy Spirit.

contents.verseText: I have therefore my glorying in Christ Jesus in things pertaining to God.
contents: I have therefore my glorying in Christ Jesus in things pertaining to God.

contents.verseText: For I will not dare to speak of any things save those which Christ wrought through me, for the obedience of the Gentiles, by word and deed,
contents: For I will not dare to speak of any things save those which Christ wrought through me, for the obedience of the Gentiles,
by word and deed,

contents.verseText: in the power of signs and wonders, in the power of the Holy Spirit; so that from Jerusalem, and round about even unto Illyricum, I have fully preached the gospel of Christ;
contents: in the power of signs and wonders, in the power of the Holy Spirit; so that from Jerusalem, and round about even unto
Illyricum, I have fully preached the gospel of Christ;

contents.verseText: yea, making it my aim so to preach the gospel, not where Christ was already named, that I might not build upon another man’s foundation;
contents: yea, making it my aim so to preach the gospel, not where Christ was
named, that I might not build upon another man’s foundation;

contents.verseText: but, as it is written, They shall see, to whom no tidings of him came, And they who have not heard shall understand.
contents: but, as it is written,
They shall see, to whom no tidings of him came,
And they who have not heard shall understand.

contents.verseText: Wherefore also I was hindered these many times from coming to you:
contents: Wherefore also I was hindered these many times from coming to you:

contents.verseText: but now, having no more any place in these regions, and having these many years a longing to come unto you,
contents: but now, having no more any place in these regions, and having these many years a longing to come unto you,

contents.verseText: whensoever I go unto Spain (for I hope to see you in my journey, and to be brought on my way thitherward by you, if first in some measure I shall have been satisfied with your company)—
contents: whensoever I go unto Spain (for I hope to see you in my journey, and to be brought on my way thitherward by you, if first
in some measure I shall have been satisfied with your company)—

contents.verseText: but now, I say, I go unto Jerusalem, ministering unto the saints.
contents: but now,
, I go unto Jerusalem, ministering unto the saints.

contents.verseText: For it hath been the good pleasure of Macedonia and Achaia to make a certain contribution for the poor among the saints that are at Jerusalem.
contents: For it hath been the good pleasure of Macedonia and Achaia to make a certain contribution for the poor among the saints
that are at Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: Yea, it hath been their good pleasure; and their debtors they are. For if the Gentiles have been made partakers of their spiritual things, they owe it to them also to minister unto them in carnal things.
contents: Yea, it hath been their good pleasure; and their debtors they are. For if the Gentiles have been made partakers of their
spiritual things, they owe it
also to minister unto them in carnal things.

contents.verseText: When therefore I have accomplished this, and have sealed to them this fruit, I will go on by you unto Spain.
contents: When therefore I have accomplished this, and have sealed to them this fruit, I will go on by you unto Spain.

contents.verseText: And I know that, when I come unto you, I shall come in the fulness of the blessing of Christ.
contents: And I know that, when I come unto you, I shall come in the fulness of the blessing of Christ.

contents.verseText: Now I beseech you, brethren, by our Lord Jesus Christ, and by the love of the Spirit, that ye strive together with me in your prayers to God for me;
contents: Now I beseech you, brethren, by our Lord Jesus Christ, and by the love of the Spirit, that ye strive together with me in
your prayers to God for me;

contents.verseText: that I may be delivered from them that are disobedient in Judæa, and that my ministration which I have for Jerusalem may be acceptable to the saints;
contents: that I may be delivered from them that are disobedient in Judæa, and
my ministration which
for Jerusalem may be acceptable to the saints;

contents.verseText: that I may come unto you in joy through the will of God, and together with you find rest.
contents: that I may come unto you in joy through the will of God, and together with you find rest.

contents.verseText: Now the God of peace be with you all. Amen.
contents: Now the God of peace be with you all. Amen.

contents.verseText: I commend unto you Phoebe our sister, who is a servant of the church that is at Cenchreæ:
contents: I commend unto you Phoebe our sister, who is a servant of the church that is at Cenchreæ:

contents.verseText: that ye receive her in the Lord, worthily of the saints, and that ye assist her in whatsoever matter she may have need of you: for she herself also hath been a helper of many, and of mine own self.
contents: that ye receive her in the Lord, worthily of the saints, and that ye assist her in whatsoever matter she may have need of
you: for she herself also hath been a helper of many, and of mine own self.

contents.verseText: Salute Prisca and Aquila my fellow-workers in Christ Jesus,
contents: Salute Prisca and Aquila my fellow-workers in Christ Jesus,

contents.verseText: who for my life laid down their own necks; unto whom not only I give thanks, but also all the churches of the Gentiles:
contents: who for my life laid down their own necks; unto whom not only I give thanks, but also all the churches of the Gentiles:

contents.verseText: and salute the church that is in their house. Salute Epænetus my beloved, who is the firstfruits of Asia unto Christ.
contents: and
the church that is in their house. Salute Epænetus my beloved, who is the firstfruits of Asia unto
Christ.

contents.verseText: Salute Mary, who bestowed much labor on you.
contents: Salute Mary, who bestowed much labor on you.

contents.verseText: Salute Andronicus and Junias, my kinsmen, and my fellow-prisoners, who are of note among the apostles, who also have been in Christ before me.
contents: Salute Andronicus and Junias, my kinsmen, and my fellow-prisoners, who are of note among the apostles, who also have been
in Christ before me.

contents.verseText: Salute Ampliatus my beloved in the Lord.
contents: Salute Ampliatus my beloved in the Lord.

contents.verseText: Salute Urbanus our fellow-worker in Christ, and Stachys my beloved.
contents: Salute Urbanus our fellow-worker in Christ, and Stachys my beloved.

contents.verseText: Salute Apelles the approved in Christ. Salute them that are of the household of Aristobulus.
contents: Salute Apelles the approved in Christ. Salute them that are of the
of Aristobulus.

contents.verseText: Salute Herodion my kinsman. Salute them of the household of Narcissus, that are in the Lord.
contents: Salute Herodion my kinsman. Salute them of the
of Narcissus, that are in the Lord.

contents.verseText: Salute Tryphæna and Tryphosa, who labor in the Lord. Salute Persis the beloved, who labored much in the Lord.
contents: Salute Tryphæna and Tryphosa, who labor in the Lord. Salute Persis the beloved, who labored much in the Lord.

contents.verseText: Salute Rufus the chosen in the Lord, and his mother and mine.
contents: Salute Rufus the chosen in the Lord, and his mother and mine.

contents.verseText: Salute Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermes, Patrobas, Hermas, and the brethren that are with them.
contents: Salute Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermes, Patrobas, Hermas, and the brethren that are with them.

contents.verseText: Salute Philologus and Julia, Nereus and his sister, and Olympas, and all the saints that are with them.
contents: Salute Philologus and Julia, Nereus and his sister, and Olympas, and all the saints that are with them.

contents.verseText: Salute one another with a holy kiss. All the churches of Christ salute you.
contents: Salute one another with a holy kiss. All the churches of Christ salute you.

contents.verseText: Now I beseech you, brethren, mark them that are causing the divisions and occasions of stumbling, contrary to the doctrine which ye learned: and turn away from them.
contents: Now I beseech you, brethren, mark them that are causing the divisions and occasions of stumbling, contrary to the
doctrine which ye learned: and turn away from them.

contents.verseText: For they that are such serve not our Lord Christ, but their own belly; and by their smooth and fair speech they beguile the hearts of the innocent.
contents: For they that are such serve not our Lord Christ, but their own belly; and by their smooth and fair speech they beguile
the hearts of the innocent.

contents.verseText: For your obedience is come abroad unto all men. I rejoice therefore over you: but I would have you wise unto that which is good, and simple unto that which is evil.
contents: For your obedience is come abroad unto all men. I rejoice therefore over you: but I would have you wise unto that which
is good, and simple unto that which is evil.

contents.verseText: And the God of peace shall bruise Satan under your feet shortly. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
contents: And the God of peace shall bruise Satan under your feet shortly.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.

contents.verseText: Timothy my fellow-worker saluteth you; and Lucius and Jason and Sosipater, my kinsmen.
contents: Timothy my fellow-worker saluteth you; and Lucius and Jason and Sosipater, my kinsmen.

contents.verseText: I Tertius, who write the epistle, salute you in the Lord.
contents: I Tertius, who write the epistle, salute you in the Lord.

contents.verseText: Gaius my host, and of the whole church, saluteth you. Erastus the treasurer of the city saluteth you, and Quartus the brother.
contents: Gaius my host, and of the whole church, saluteth you. Erastus the treasurer of the city saluteth you, and Quartus the
brother.

footnote.ft: Some ancient authorities insert here v. 24

footnote.fqa: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.

footnote.ft:
and omit the like words in v.
20.

contents.verseText: Now to him that is able to establish you according to my gospel and the preaching of Jesus Christ, according to the revelation of the mystery which hath been kept in silence through times eternal,
contents: Now to him that is able to establish you according to my gospel and the preaching of Jesus Christ, according to the
revelation of the mystery which hath been kept in silence through times eternal,

contents.verseText: but now is manifested, and by the scriptures of the prophets, according to the commandment of the eternal God, is made known unto all the nations unto obedience of faith:
contents: but now is manifested, and by the scriptures of the prophets, according to the commandment of the eternal God, is made
known unto all the nations unto obedience of faith:

contents.verseText: to the only wise God, through Jesus Christ, to whom be the glory for ever. Amen.
contents: to the only wise God, through Jesus Christ, to whom be the glory for ever. Amen.

_warnings: Trailing spaces present at line end.
Consecutive use of empty paragraph markers.
